name: Seven Layer Dip
author: USA WEEKEND columnist Pam Anderson
summary: Perk up this classic dish with fresh lime juice and homemade guacamole.
ingredients: 1 (4.5 ounce) can chopped green chiles, undrained
2 tablespoons fresh lime juice for avocado layer
3  avocados, halved, pitted, flesh spooned out
1 cup salsa (drain to equal 1 cup if salsa is especially runny)
¾ cup sliced canned black olives, drained
½ cup thin sliced scallion greens, green part only
directions: of lime juice, chili powder, cumin, and a pinch of salt in a small bowl
In a second small bowl, mash avocados with a fork; stir in remaining 2 Tbs
lime juice and 1/2 teaspoon of salt to make guacamole
In a third small bowl, mix sour cream and mayonnaise
Spread bean mixture, then guacamole, then sour cream mixture, and finally salsa over the bottom of a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate or similar size pan
(Dip can be covered and refrigerated up to 2 days) To serve, sprinkle with green onions
